info.title: NetSuite REST Record API
info.description: NetSuite REST Record API generated 2024-05-24 at 12:35:07 UTC for account TSTDRV1303059, user joe.klug@peregrineconnect.com with role Neuron ESB Integration.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query that is used to filter results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit used to specify the number of results on a single page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset used for selecting a specific page of results.

parameters.name: Prefer
parameters.description: The server behavior requested by the client. Use 'respond-async' to execute the request asynchronously. If the request is executed asynchronously, 'Preference-applied: respond-async' is returned in the response.

parameters.description: A user-defined unique idempotency key that is applied to every asynchronous requests to ensure that the request is executed only once. Only one request can be executed with every unique idempotency key. Use UUID in string format as defined by RFC 4122. If the request is executed synchronously, this value is ignored.

parameters.name: replace
parameters.description: The names of sublists on this record. All sublist lines will be replaced with lines specified in the request. The names are delimited by comma.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyNameValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property name validation.

parameters.name: X-NetSuite-PropertyValueValidation
parameters.description: Sets the strictness of property value validation.

X-NetSuite-PropertyValidation.description: The description of a property validation failure.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Internal identifier.

parameters.name: expandSubResources
parameters.description: Set to 'true' to automatically expand all sublists, sublist lines, and subrecords on this record.

parameters.name: simpleEnumFormat
parameters.description: Set to true to return enumeration values in a format that only shows the internal ID value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The names of the fields and sublists on the record. Only the selected fields and sublists will be returned in the response.

X-NetSuite-Warning.description: Warning messages that occurred during processing.

parameters.description: If set to 'true', all fields that should be deleted in the update request, including body fields, must be included in the 'replace' query parameter.

type.title: Type
type.description: A URI reference to the documentation about the problem type.

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable description of the problem type.

status.title: Status
status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the server the request originates from.

o:errorDetails.description: An array containing one or more problem types.

detail.title: Detail
detail.description: A detailed, human-readable description of the problem occurrence.

o:errorPath.title: Error Path
o:errorPath.description: The JSON path that indicates where the problem occurs within the request body.

o:errorUrl.title: Error URL
o:errorUrl.description: The URI of the first element in the request URL where the problem occurs.

o:errorHeader.title: Error Header
o:errorHeader.description: The name of the HTTP header where the problem occurs.

o:errorQueryParam.title: Error Query Parameter
o:errorQueryParam.description: The name of the query parameter where the problem occurs.

o:errorCode.title: Error Code
o:errorCode.description: The application-specific error code. Similar problem types are grouped together.

zip.title: Zip
zip.description: Enter the postal code the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr2.title: Address 2
addr2.description: Enter an optional second address line the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters.

city.title: City
city.description: Enter the city the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr1.title: Address 1
addr1.description: Enter the address the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters. This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

addressee.title: Addressee
addressee.description: Enter the name of the entity that should appear on the shipping label here. This name appears on the shipping label below what you enter in the Attention field.

attention.title: Attention
attention.description: Enter the name of the person to whom a shipment is addressed, as it should appear on shipping labels. This field is required for UPS Integration.

override.title: Override
override.description: Check this box to disable the free-form address text field. When this field is disabled, text entered in the other address fields does not display in the Address text field. Clear this box to allow text entered in the address component fields to appear in the free-form address text field.

state.title: State/Province
state.description: Enter your company's state or province the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addrText.title: Address
addrText.description: The values entered in the other address fields are displayed here.

zip.title: Zip
zip.description: Enter the postal code the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr2.title: Address 2
addr2.description: Enter an optional second address line the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters.

city.title: City
city.description: Enter the city the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addr1.title: Address 1
addr1.description: Enter the address the way it should appear on forms. For employees, customers, partners, and vendors, what you enter here autofills on forms if this address is marked default for Shipping or Billing. Enter up to 50 characters. This field is required for the Online Bill Pay feature.

addressee.title: Addressee
addressee.description: Enter the name of the entity that should appear on the shipping label here. This name appears on the shipping label below what you enter in the Attention field.

attention.title: Attention
attention.description: Enter the name of the person to whom a shipment is addressed, as it should appear on shipping labels. This field is required for UPS Integration.

override.title: Override
override.description: Check this box to disable the free-form address text field. When this field is disabled, text entered in the other address fields does not display in the Address text field. Clear this box to allow text entered in the address component fields to appear in the free-form address text field.

state.title: State/Province
state.description: Enter your company's state or province the way it should appear on all forms except checks.

addrText.title: Address
addrText.description: The values entered in the other address fields are displayed here.

tranDate.title: Date
tranDate.description: NetSuite inserts today's date for the posting date of this purchase order. You can type or pick another date. What you enter here determines the date range in which this transaction appears on the Purchase Orders Register. You can select or enter custom date ranges on registers.

memo.title: Memo
memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this order. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Purchase Orders register.

billAddress.title: Bill To
billAddress.description: By default, NetSuite inserts the vendor mailing address from the vendor record in the Vendor Select field, : * Select New to enter a new address to use for this transaction and save to the associated vendor record. * Select Custom to enter a new address to use for this transaction only. It is not saved with the associated vendor record. * Click the Edit icon to modify an existing vendor address.

custbody_sii_not_reported_in_time.title: Billing Record Cannot Be Submitted On Time

shipAddress.title: Ship To
shipAddress.description: When you select a customer in the Ship To field in the header of this transaction, the customer's default shipping address autofills this field. If the Ship To field in the header of this transaction is blank, your company shipping address autofills this field. You can view and edit your company shipping address at Setup > Company Information. To change the shipping address that autofills: * Select another address in the Ship To Select field. * Select New in the Ship To Select field to enter a new billing address.

toBePrinted.title: To Be Printed
toBePrinted.description: Check this box if you wish to save this in a queue of purchase orders to print. Otherwise, you can click Print below to submit and print this purchase order at once.

toBeEmailed.title: To Be Emailed
toBeEmailed.description: Check this box if you want to e-mail this purchase order. Then enter the e-mail address in the space to the right of the check box. You can enter multiple e-mail addresses by separating them with semicolons. It is important to separate the addresses with only semicolons, and do not include any spaces.

trackingNumbers.title: Tracking Numbers
trackingNumbers.description: Enter the shipment tracking number from the shipping company. If a tracking number is entered in the exact format used by UPS or FedEx and the transaction is saved, the tracking number will show on the transaction as a link to the UPS or FedEx website. You can click the link to check the status of the shipment.

fob.title: FOB
fob.description: Enter the location where you technically acquire ownership. For example, if you own goods as soon as they ship and pay the shipping costs from your vendor s location to your own, you might enter Shipping point.

custbody_doc_num_summ_invoice.title: Last Document Number Of Summary Invoice

otherRefNum.title: PO/Check Number
otherRefNum.description: NetSuite inserts your account number for this vendor as entered at Lists > Relationships > Vendors on the Financial subtab for this vendor's record.

exchangeRate.title: Exchange Rate
exchangeRate.description: The currency's exchange rate is shown in this field. You can edit the exchange rate for this transaction only, or you can update the currency record with the exchange rate you enter here.

toBeFaxed.title: To Be Faxed
toBeFaxed.description: Check this box if you want to fax this purchase order. Enter the fax number in the space to the right of the check box if it doesn't already appear. To fax NetSuite forms, an administrator must first set up fax service at Setup > Company > Printing, Fax and Email Preferences.

total.title: Total
total.description: NetSuite computes the total of line items and then enters it here.

shipDate.title: Ship Date
shipDate.description: Enter the date you expect the items to be shipped.

tranId.title: PO #
tranId.description: NetSuite increases the largest purchase order number by one. If you wish, you can type another number. The next PO number will revert to the standard pattern. Note: The maximum number of characters you can enter in this field is 45.

message.title: Vendor Message
message.description: If you wish, type a message that will appear on the Purchase Order form.

supervisorApproval.title: Supervisor Approval
supervisorApproval.description: If you have permission to approve this purchase order, check the Supervisor Approval box.

dueDate.title: Due Date
dueDate.description: Enter the date by which the items to be ordered are needed.

items.title: Items
items.description: An array field that represents a collection of elements, for example, sublist lines, multiselect items, or search results.
